extra_notes: You can call me Nate for short!
I know it's a bit of a mouthful, it's a Thai name!

career_outlook: I'm open for any role that is meaningful and can make an impact.

work_experience.description: As Lead Product Designer at Invitrace Health, I believe our solutions bring real value to healthcare. I manage a team of designers, build scalable design systems, explore new technologies, and shape user flows to create seamless experiences. I‚Äôm passionate about mentoring my team and driving meaningful impact through thoughtful design.

Collaborated with multiple teams from start to finish, conducting research to create a seamless experience. Designed information architecture by conducting card sorting with users. Utilized user information to create wireframes and conduct testing with the target user personas. Defined a style guide, components, and colors to ensure consistency across both the mobile app and web app.

work_experience.summary: Worked on a small project to rapidly ship a COVID vaccine passport.
work_experience.description: As a Senior UX/UI Designer at Doctor Anywhere, I was involved in a fast-paced project to design and ship a COVID vaccine passport. The focus was on rapid development and deployment to meet urgent public health needs.

work_experience.summary: Designed an award-winning mutual fund application for a finance company.
work_experience.description: As a Senior Designer at Codefin, a finance company, I was contracted to build a mutual fund application. This project was recognized for its excellence, receiving an award for customer experience in Asia.
achievements: Awarded for customer experience in Asia for the mutual fund application.

work_experience.summary: Entered the real world of UX/UI design in the financial sector.
work_experience.description: At Peakaccount, I began my journey as a UX/UI Designer, gaining hands-on experience in the financial industry. This role provided foundational knowledge and practical skills in designing user experiences and interfaces within a real-world business context.

competencies.name: User Research
competencies.description: Ability to gather deep insights through interviews, surveys, field studies, and usability testing to inform design decisions.

competencies.name: Problem Framing
competencies.description: Skill in identifying the real problem, defining it clearly, and aligning it with user and business goals before ideation.

competencies.name: UX Strategy
competencies.description: Capability to align user experience with business objectives and roadmap; creating a design vision that drives product direction.

competencies.name: Information Architecture
competencies.description: Structuring content and features into a usable, clear hierarchy that supports user understanding and ease of navigation.

competencies.name: Interaction Design
competencies.description: Designing user flows, microinteractions, and system behavior to create intuitive and delightful experiences.

competencies.name: Visual Design
competencies.description: Creating high-quality UI with attention to typography, color, layout, and visual hierarchy that reflects brand identity.

competencies.name: Design Systems
competencies.description: Building and maintaining scalable design systems that ensure consistency and speed up design/development workflows.

competencies.name: Prototyping
competencies.description: Creating interactive prototypes to test concepts quickly and communicate design ideas effectively with stakeholders.

competencies.name: Usability Testing
competencies.description: Running structured and unstructured tests with users to evaluate design effectiveness and uncover friction points.

competencies.name: Accessibility
competencies.description: Designing inclusive experiences that comply with accessibility standards (WCAG) and support diverse users.

competencies.name: Data-Informed Design
competencies.description: Ability to use qualitative and quantitative data (analytics, heatmaps, A/B tests) to refine and prioritize design decisions.

competencies.name: Cross-functional Collaboration
competencies.description: Effectively working with PMs, engineers, marketers, and stakeholders to ensure smooth product development and alignment.

competencies.name: Communication & Storytelling
competencies.description: Explaining design rationale, presenting work clearly, and telling compelling stories to build empathy and buy-in.

competencies.name: Design Ops & Workflow
competencies.description: Improving design team operations through process, tools, file management, version control, and documentation.

competencies.name: Design Leadership
competencies.description: Guiding teams, mentoring junior designers, advocating for design, and influencing product direction at a strategic level.
